comment.body:
They just don't want the public to have an independent platform, and they say what they think they need to say. 

Why I think this: ZeroNet is not a "secret communication" platform. It uses DHT, there are no private sites, etc, etc.... 

There many much more suitable platforms, but the difference is, ZeroNet is more easily reachable and available (but, again, this shouldn't need to be a problem if security experts wants to do business)
